dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 6423 IH: Foster and Homeless Youth Food Security Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Davis of Illinois (for himself, Ms. Norton, Ms. Jackson Lee, Mr. Cleaver, Mr. Mullin, Mr. García of Illinois, and Ms. Brown) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 to provide certain alternative eligibility requirements applicable to foster care youth, and homeless youth, who are enrolled at least half-time in an institution of higher education, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Foster and Homeless Youth Food Security Act of 2023.

subsection.text: Section 3 of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2012) is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting after subsection (j) the following:

means an individual whose care and placement are the responsibility of the State or Tribal agency that administers a State or Tribal plan under part B or E of title IV of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 621 et seq.), without regard to whether foster care maintenance payments are made under section 472 of such Act (42 U.S.C. 672) on behalf of such individual; and

includes an individual who was age 13 or older when the individual’s care and placement were the responsibility of a State or Tribal agency that administered a State or Tribal plan under part B or E of title IV of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 621 et seq.) and who is no longer under the care and responsibility of such a State or tribal agency, without regard to any such individual’s subsequent adoption, guardianship arrangement, or other form of permanency outcome.

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2) by striking or at the end;
by redesignating paragraph (2) as paragraph (3); and
by inserting after paragraph (1) the following:

paragraph.text: a homeless child or youth as defined in section 725 of the McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act; or

subsection.text: Section 3(k) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2012(k)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking and (9) the 1st place it appears and inserting (9), and (10);
by striking and (9) the last place it appears and inserting (9); and
by inserting before the period at the end the following:

quoted-block.quoted-block-continuation-text: and, (10) meals prepared and served by an institution of higher education (as defined in the Higher Education Act of 1965) that has has in effect a program participation agreement with the Secretary of Education in accordance with section 487(a) of the Higher Education Act of 1965, for consumption by a foster care individual, or a homeless individual, over 17 and not over 26 years of age enrolled at least half-time in such institution (as determined by such institution) that provides such individual with housing that lacks an individualized cooking facility

subsection.text: Section 3(m)(5) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2012(m)(5)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: Foster care individuals, or homeless individuals, over 17 and not over 26 years of age enrolled at least half-time in an institution of higher education (as determined by such institution) that provides such individuals with housing that lacks individualized cooking facilities.

subsection.text: Section 3(o)(2) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2012(o)(2)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting institution after program; and
by striking and (9) and inserting (9), and (10).

subsection.text: Section 6(e) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2015(e)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (7) by striking or at the end;
by redesignating paragraph (8) as paragraph (9); and
by inserting after paragraph (7) the following:
is a foster care individual, or a homeless individual, over 17 and not over 26 years of age who is so enrolled as determined by such institution; or

section.text: The Secretary of Agriculture shall provide technical assistance or guidance to State agencies for the purpose of implementing the amendments made by this Act.
